reviews.text: I was on a business trip and stayed in this hotel for 12 days. I would say this is one of the best hotels for foreigners in Sofia. All the staff understand English and are very professional in communication. Had a nice spread of breakfast. For a vegetarian there were a lot of options to choose from. Located at a convenient location not very far from Serdika station and city centre. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Best thing about this hotel is the Receptionists, really helpful with good English.
Hotel is tired as others have said and needs a refurb, carpets are filthy, mattress protectors are stained!  Cleaners do the best they can with what they are working with. Complimentary toiletries good. Tea coffee in room, get milk from breakfast room
Breakfast ok but we paid €16 for two at the end of breakfast.
Easy walk to metro, straight from airport and back. Easy walk to centre, if you don’t mind walking 30mins. Trams are super noisy and many , going across a broken crossroads so you can’t open the window (I did try ignoring them! )

Just wanted to give a shout-out to the staff of this hotel for finding my passport in the room and calling us hurriedly about it. There are some really good people working in this spot and I’m so grateful to have had such a great time in this hotel. Rooms were clean, beds were comfy, breakfast was nice (drank too much coffee maybe that’s why I left my passport there :D) and the staff went above and beyond to help me check for allergens in the breakfast items.
The hotel was overall good to visit Sophia. Room was non super big but enough the stay a couple of nights. Overall a good experience. The room was ready at 11 am. Good experience.
Stayed for 1 night before moving on from Sofia. Good hotel, helpful staff, nothing special. Good location, can walk everywhere and street is quiet. Great water pressure and big bathroom.
